Ability Learnset

By leveling up

Level Ability Score Description
1 Sand Veil 3 Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness in a sandstorm.
1 Sand Rush 6 Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in a sandstorm.
18 Simple 8 The stat changes the Pokémon receives are doubled.
36 Frisk 5 When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.
54 Guts 6 It's so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat.
72 Dry Skin 6 Rain and Water-type moves restore HP. Sunlight and Fire-type damage hurt more.
90 Defiant 8 Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat sharply when its stats are lowered.
100 Muddy Surge 9 Turns the ground into Muddy Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.
  • Bold indicates a default ability if multiple abilities are disabled
  • Italic indicates hidden ability if multiple abilities are disabled

By Disc

Disc Ability Score Description
Disc 03 Own Tempo 4 This Pokémon has its own tempo, and that prevents it from becoming confused.
Disc 11 Ball Fetch 1 If the Pokémon is not holding an item, it will fetch the first failed thrown Poké Ball.
Disc 17 Mimicry 3 Changes the Pokémon's type depending on the terrain.
Disc 19 Sand Force 7 Boosts the power of Rock-, Ground-, and Steel-type moves in a sandstorm.
Disc 29 Sand Spit 5 The Pokémon creates a sandstorm when it's hit by an attack.
Disc 45 Toxic Boost 6 Powers up physical attacks when the Pokémon is poisoned.
  • Bold indicates a default ability if multiple abilities are disabled
  • Italic indicates hidden ability if multiple abilities are disabled

By tutoring

Ability Score Description
Analytic 6 Boosts move power when the Pokémon moves last.
Arena Lock 9 Negates statuses that affect the whole field.
Arena Trap 10 Prevents opposing Pokémon from fleeing.
Competitive 7 Boosts the Sp. Atk stat sharply when a stat is lowered.
Defeatist -2 Halves the Pokémon's Attack and Sp. Atk stats when its HP becomes half or less.
Defiant 8 Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat sharply when its stats are lowered.
Dry Skin 6 Rain and Water-type moves restore HP. Sunlight and Fire-type damage hurt more.
Early Bird 4 The Pokémon awakens from sleep twice as fast as other Pokémon.
Emergency Exit 4 The Pokémon, sensing danger, switches out when its HP becomes half or less.
Frisk 5 When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.
Guts 6 It's so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat.
Hustle 7 Boosts the Attack stat, but lowers accuracy.
Hyper Cutter 2 The Pokémon's pride of its pincers prevents other Pokémon from lowering its Attack stat.
Infiltrator 8 Passes through the opposing Pokémon's barrier, substitute, and the like and strikes.
Inner Focus 3 The Pokémon's intensely focused, and that protects the Pokémon from flinching.
Klutz -2 The Pokémon can't use any held items.
Mold Breaker 9 Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.
Moody 10 Raises one stat sharply and lowers another every turn.
Muddy Surge 9 Turns the ground into Muddy Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.
Pickup 2 The Pokémon may pick up the items, both during and outside of battle.
Quick Draw 7 Enables the Pokémon to move first occasionally.
Rattled 4 Dark-, Ghost-, and Bug-type moves scare the Pokémon and boost its Speed stat.
Reckless 7 Powers up moves that have recoil damage.
Regenerator 8 Restores a little HP when withdrawn from battle.
Run Away 1 Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.
Sand Rush 6 Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in a sandstorm.
Sand Veil 3 Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness in a sandstorm.
Scrappy 6 The Pokémon can hit Ghost-type Pokémon with Normal- and Fighting-type moves.
Simple 8 The stat changes the Pokémon receives are doubled.
Stall -2 The Pokémon moves after all other Pokémon do.
Steadfast 2 The Pokémon's determination boosts the Speed stat each time the Pokémon flinches.
Terralate 8 Normal-type moves become Ground-type moves. Their power is boosted a little.
Unburden 8 Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon's held item is used or lost.
  • Bold indicates a default ability if multiple abilities are disabled
  • Italic indicates hidden ability if multiple abilities are disabled
